title: Input Shaft - Disassembly

body.body: The numbers in brackets in the following text refer to the exploded view below.
Working from the opposite end to where the clutch assembly is fitted, dismantle the input shaft as follows:
Mark one side of second gear to denote its correct orientation. Remove second gear (2).
Remove the splined thrust washer, locking outer (3) and the splined thrust washer, locking inner (4) from in front of sixth gear.
Mark one side of sixth gear to denote its correct orientation. Remove sixth gear (5) complete with the split needle roller bearing (6) which runs inside the gear.
Remove the splined thrust washer (7) and snap ring (8) between sixth and third/fourth gears. Discard the snap ring.
Mark one side of the combined third/fourth gear to denote its correct orientation. Remove the combined third/fourth gear (9).
Remove the snap ring (10) and the splined thrust washer (11) from in front of fifth gear. Discard the snap ring.
Mark one side of fifth gear to denote its correct orientation. Remove fifth gear (12) complete with the split needle roller bearing (13) which runs inside the gear.

When using a press, always wear overalls, eye, face and hand protection. Objects such as bearings frequently break-up under load and the debris caused during break-up may cause damage and injury to unprotected parts of the body.
Never wear loose clothing, which could become trapped in the press and cause crushing injuries to the hand, arms or other parts of the anatomy.

Unless the bearing at the clutch end of the input shaft is damaged or worn, it is not normally necessary to remove it from the shaft. The bearing is pressed onto the shaft and is also pressed into its housing. The bearing and housing are removed from the shaft together and are then separated.
Support the bearing and housing (15 and 16) on press bars, then press the shaft (14) through the bearing and housing.
Press only on the bearing outer race to prevent bearing damage.
Support the outer circumference of the bearing housing on press bars, then press the bearing outer race to remove the bearing.
